sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>canopy</radical> <radical>attach</radical>ing your entire country is the <kanji>government</kanji>. They loom over you all and try to keep you all organized and together under their control.
meaningInfo: Picture a map of the world with actual canopies attached to each government, representing the ruling governments of each place.
readingMnemonic: Try to get out from under this <kanji>government</kanji> canopy and you'll be labeled a <reading>foo</reading>l (<ja>ふ</ja>). Unless... you can fool them!
readingInfo: Think of all the people who've been labeled as fools by the government because they try to detach themselves from under their reach. It's a pretty long list...
